title: Is Poirot dead in real life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Poirot is a fictional character, but I know what you mean, lol. ‘On the ITV television series, Poirot died in October 1949 from complications of a heart condition at the end of Curtain: Poirot's Last Case. This took place at Styles Court, scene of his first English case in 1916. In Christie's novels, he lived into the late 1960s, perhaps even until 1975 when Curtain was published.’ Source: Wikipedia Edited to add that the wonderful David Suchet (who played Poirot in the magnificent ITV series) is very much alive and is still a fantastic actor.
